reference.title: Enabling Couchbase services
reference.shortdesc: Couchbase services are enabled when adding or joining a node to a cluster.

section.title: Description
section.p: Command used to add a node to a cluster and specifying the service.
section.note: Couchbase services can only be enabled via the REST API when adding a server to an existing cluster. To initialized cluster (with the first node) with any Couchbase service other than the Data service (default), use the Couchbase web console.

section.title: Syntax
section.p: Joining a node to a cluster:
section.codeblock: curl -u [admin]:[password] -d clusterMemberHostIp=[ip-address] \ -d clusterMemberPort=[port] \ -d user=[admin] -d password=[password] http://[localhost]:8091/node/controller/doJoinCluster -d -s services=[Data | Index | n1ql]

section.title: Example
section.p: Joining a node to a cluster:
section.codeblock: curl -u admin:password -d clusterMemberHostIp=192.168.0.1 \ -d clusterMemberPort=8091 \ -d user=admin -d password=password http://10.5.2.54:8091/node/controller/doJoinCluster -d -s "services=index"
